name: William McGonagle
title: Developer
biography: William McGonagle is a freshman at Georgetown University in the McDonough School of Business. He joined GDT in the fall of 2023 because of the computer science community surrounding the club. Originally from Bridgeport, Connecticut, William is passionate about sailing, writing, and spending time outside.
works: William is currently the project leader on the Rotogravure project. As the project lead, he manages the development team and collaborates with the newspapers to ensure a quality platform.

name: Pk Karnik
title: Developer
biography: I am a first-year student who calls New Canaan, Connecticut home. As someone with an international family with many people who work in tech, I have always been interested in how these two issues intersect and thus, as a student in the SFS, am drawn to Georgetown Disruptive Tech. I have coded in high-school before (albeit in a more classroom environment) and look forward to working to build on my skills in innovative ways.
works: As part of the Developer team, I am helping to modernize and digitize the Hoyaâ€™s online presence. I am looking forward to making sure we have a secure system and also ensuring its scalability so we can work with college newspapers across the country and maybe even work with Canadian institutions.
